*i = ignore failure to load (optional)

Default = 1000 ms
Literal unquoted 'NoMouse'. Prevents mouse clicks from resetting the hotstring recognizer.
Default = -()[]{}':;"/\,.?!`n`s`t Literal unquoted 'EndChars' followed by a single space and then the new ending characters.
Specify new Hotstring options.
*i = ignore failure to load (optional)

*i = ignore failure to load (optional)
Default = 0 Controls which artificial keyboard and mouse events are ignored by hotkeys and hotstrings.
Default = 10
Default = False Causes some or all hotkeys to buffer rather than ignore keypresses when their #MaxThreadsPerHotkey limit has been reached.
Default = 1 Sets the maximum number of simultaneous threads per hotkey or hotstring.
The built-in variable A_IconHidden can also be used to toggle the tray icon.

Examples: #Requires AutoHotkey v1.1 #Requires AutoHotkey >=v2.0.1
* prepending 'v' is optional
Default = Prompt Literal unquoted string.
Default = True Exempts hotkeys and hotstrings that follow from suspension.
Default = True Forces the use of the hook to implement all or some keyboard hotkeys.
WarnType = VarUnset, LocalSameAsGlobal, Unreachable, All WarnMode = MsgBox, StdOut, OutputDebug, Off
Skips the gentle method of activating a window and goes straight to the forceful method.

Number must be between -1 and 1.

Number must be between -1 and 1.
Returns radians.
Returns radians.
All options are literal unquoted strings.
All options are literal unquoted strings.
Returns: obj{Ptr, Size}
Options: Fast (F) = avoids starting a new thread on func callout CDecl (C) = make addresses conform to 'C' calling convention & = Causes the addresses of param list to be passed instead of params

Try Statement(s) Catch [ErrorClass] [as OutputVar] { Statements }
Error Classes: MemoryError = Memory allocation failed. OSError = Win32 func call failed. TargetError = Gui target could not be found (window or control). TimeoutError = SendMessage timed out. TypeError = Unexpected type (subjective, use as desired). UnsetError = Var does not exist, or is unset / no value. - MemberError - PropertyError - MethodError - UnsetItemError ValueError = Unexpected type (subjective, use as desired). IndexError = Requested __Index[] was invalid or out of range. ZeroDivisionError

Returns an integer after rounding up.
Example:
MsgBox Ceil(1.2) ; Returns 2 MsgBox Ceil(-1.2) ; Returns -1

[Options] are a combination of the following:
Specify the X/Y coords where the click should happen. Click '100 200'
Specify which button: Left|L|Right|R|Middle|M|X1|X2 Click 'Left' ('Left' can be omitted in most cases)
Specify click count: Click '2' (2 left clicks - doubleclick) Click '100 200 2' (2 left clicks at specified coords) Click '100 200 Right 2' (2 right clicks ar specified coords)
Up or Down: Click 'Down' (clicks left button and holds it) Click 'Right Down' (clicks right button and holds it)
Relative Click '100 200 Right Rel (clicks right button at specified coords, but relative to current mouse pos)

Seconds = Integer or decimal WaitFor: 0 = wait for text or files 1 = any data
Return: 0 = timed out 1 = didn't time out
Types = Str, WStr, AStr, Int64, Int, Short, Char, Float, Double, Ptr, HRESULT, UInt64, UInt, UShort, UChar, UPtr Default ReturnType is HRESULT.
Retrieves a registered COM obj.
Creates a SafeArray for use with COM.
Connects a COM object's event source to the script, enabling events to be handled.
Retrieves or changes flags which control a COM wrapper object's behaviour.
Wraps a raw IDispatch pointer (COM object) for use by the script.
Returns a reference to an object provided by a COM component.
Queries a COM object for an interface or service.

Retrieves type information from a COM object.
VT_EMPTY := 0 ; No value VT_NULL := 1 ; SQL-style Null VT_I2 := 2 ; 16-bit signed int VT_I4 := 3 ; 32-bit signed int VT_R4 := 4 ; 32-bit floating-point number VT_R8 := 5 ; 64-bit floating-point number VT_CY := 6 ; Currency VT_DATE := 7 ; Date VT_BSTR := 8 ; COM string (Unicode string with length prefix) VT_DISPATCH := 9 ; COM object VT_ERROR := 0xA ; Error code (32-bit integer) VT_BOOL := 0xB ; Boolean True (-1) or False (0) VT_VARIANT := 0xC ; VARIANT (must be combined with VT_ARRAY or VT_BYREF) VT_UNKNOWN := 0xD ; IUnknown interface pointer VT_DECIMAL := 0xE ; (not supported) VT_I1 := 0x10 ; 8-bit signed int VT_UI1 := 0x11 ; 8-bit unsigned int VT_UI2 := 0x12 ; 16-bit unsigned int VT_UI4 := 0x13 ; 32-bit unsigned int VT_I8 := 0x14 ; 64-bit signed int VT_UI8 := 0x15 ; 64-bit unsigned int VT_INT := 0x16 ; Signed machine int VT_UINT := 0x17 ; Unsigned machine int VT_RECORD := 0x24 ; User-defined type -- NOT SUPPORTED VT_ARRAY := 0x2000 ; SAFEARRAY VT_BYREF := 0x4000 ; Pointer to another type of value
Retrieves the value or pointer stored in a COM wrapper object.
Creates a COM object.
Wraps a value, SafeArray or COM object for use by the script or for passing to a COM method.
Adds element to ListBox or ComboBox.
Selects Nth item in ListBox, ComboBox, or Tab control.
Selects item that matches String from the beginning in ListBox, ComboBox.

Control-or-pos: ControlClick 'x100 y200', ... ControlClick Var, ... (where Var is ClassNN, text, HWND, or an obj with hwnd property)
Button: Left (L), Right (R), Middle (M), X1, X2, WheelUp (WU), WheelDown (WD)
ClickCount: Default = 1
Options: NA = possible reliability improvement D = press and hold mouse button U = release specified mouse button Pos = use only 'x y' for Control-or-pos param Xn = where to click, relative to control top left (default is center) Yn = where to click, relative to control top left (default is center)

Param.name: [[Control-or-Pos, WinTitle, WinText, WhichButton, ClickCount, Options, ExcludeTitle, ExcludeText]]

Returns item index from ListBox or ComboBox where String is an exact match.
Returns text/name of currently selected ListBox or ComboBox item.
Returns currently selected index of ListBox, ComboBox, or Tab control.
Returns array of items from ListBox, ComboBox, or DropDownList control.
Sends text to a control. Text elements such as {ENTER} and ^c are properly translated.

Overload.descr: Sends text to a control. Text elements such as {ENTER} and ^c are sent as literal text.

Options: Encoding = UTF-8, UTF-16, etc RAW = writes text without conversion `n = inserts CR before LF if not already provided
RunState: 1 = Normal 3 = Maximized 7 = Minimized

Overload.descr: CP0 : The system default ANSI code page. See remarks below. UTF-8 : Unicode UTF-8, equivalent to CP65001. UTF-8-RAW : As above, but no byte order mark is written when a new file is created. UTF-16 : Unicode UTF-16 with little endian byte order, equivalent to CP1200. UTF-16-RAW: As above, but no byte order mark is written when a new file is created. CPnnn : A code page with numeric identifier nnn. See Code Page Identifiers . nnn : A numeric code page identifier.
Return: R = READONLY A = ARCHIVE S = SYSTEM H = HIDDEN N = NORMAL D = DIRECTORY O = OFFLINE C = COMPRESSED T = TEMPORARY L = REPARSE_POINT (typically a symbolic link)
Return: R = READONLY A = ARCHIVE S = SYSTEM H = HIDDEN N = NORMAL D = DIRECTORY O = OFFLINE C = COMPRESSED T = TEMPORARY L = REPARSE_POINT (typically a symbolic link)
OutRunState: 1 = Normal 3 = Maximized 7 = Minimized
Units: B = Bytes K = Kilobytes M = Megabytes
WhichTime: M = modification time C = creation time A = last access time
Includes the specified file inside the compiled version of the script.

FileOpen('*', 'r') ; for stdin FileOpen('*', 'w') ; for stdout FileOpen('**', 'w') ; for stderr

Returns File object: Properties: Pos, Length, AtEOF, Encoding, Handle Methods: Read, Write, ReadLine, WriteLine, ReadNum[Type], WriteNum[Type], RawRead, RawWrite, Seek, Close

Filter (example): Documents (*.txt)

Attributes: R = READONLY A = ARCHIVE S = SYSTEM H = HIDDEN N = NORMAL D = DIRECTORY O = OFFLINE C = COMPRESSED T = TEMPORARY L = REPARSE_POINT (typically a symbolic link)

WhichTime: M = modification time C = creation time A = last access time
Mode: D = Include directories F = Include files (default when blank) R = Recursive into subfolders

Returns an integer after rounding down.
Example:
MsgBox Floor(1.9) ; Returns 1 MsgBox Floor(-1.2) ; Returns -2

Any number of values can be used. The values will be organized/ordered/formatted according to the FormatStr.
FormatStr: '{[ValueIndex]:Format} ... Any desired amount or combo of {elements} can be created, even referring to the same ValueIndex, which would be useful to display the same value formatted in a variety of different ways. If ValueIndex is blank, it refers to Value1. Text appearing outside {braces} is literal.
Formats:
{:10} = right aligned (default alignment), 10 characters, padding with spaces {:-10} = left aligned, 10 characters, paddnig with spaces {:010} = 10 characters, padding with zeros {:d} = value is formatted as a signed decimal integer (ie. hex to decimal) {:u} = value is formatted as an unsigned decimal integer {:o} = value is formatted as octal 0x{:X} = formats Value as hex. Use 'x' for '0xabcd' and 'X' for '0xABCD' 0x{:08X} = formats Value as hex, 8 characters, padded with zeros (on left) {:.2f} = formats value as float, 2 decimal places

TimeDate = in YYYYMMDDHH24MISS format Format = formatted date or time
Days = d, dd, ddd, dddd Months = M, MM, MMM, MMMM Year = y, yy, yyyy Hour = h, hh, H, HH (capital = 24 hr) Min = m, mm Sec = s, ss AM/PM = t, tt
Mode: P = physical state T = toggle state (CapsLock, NumLock, ScrollLock)

Example:
GoTo('MyLabel') MyLabel:
Mode: R = activates newest window in the series blank = activates oldest window in the series
Adds window to an existing group, or to a new group and creates the group.

Mode: R = closes active window, activates newest window A = all members will be closed blank = closes active window, activates oldest window
Closes the active window if it was just activated by GroupActivate or GroupDeactivate. It then activates the next window in the series. It can also close all windows in a group.
Mode: R = closes active window, activates newest non-member window blank = closes active window, activates oldest non-member window
EventObj can be a class extended from Gui, in which case method names will be used for event callback funcs.

KeyName = string
Action = Function Object, Hotkey (string), or On|Off|Toggle|AltTab
Options: On Off B = Enable buffering according to #MaxThreadsBuffer (B0 will disable it) Pn = Sets thread priority to n. S = Makes hotkey exempt from Suspend (S0 to disable this status) Tn = Max threads (n) to be used simultaneously (#MaxThreadsPerHotkey) In = Input level set to n

HotStr: A normal hotstring, ie. ':C:btw'
Replacement: The replacement text, or a function/func object to call.
MyCallback(KeyName) { ...
Gets or sets end chars for hotstrings. Default end chars: -()[]{}':;`&/\,.?!`n`s`t
Gets or sets the global settings that determines of mouse clicks reset the hotstring recognizer. Default end chars: -()[]{}':;`&/\,.?!`n`s`t
Immediately resets the hotstring recognizer.

NewOptions: * = translate hotstring instantly, without end chars ? = trigger the hotstring even if inside another word B0 = automatic backspacing is NOT done to erase the typed hotstring (turn on with B) C = case sensitive (use C0 to turn off case sensitivity) C1 = do not conformed to typed case (use C0 to turn this off) Kn = key delay (n milliseconds) for auto replace or auto backspace O = used to omit a 'custom' end char that you don't want to show in the result Pn = thread priority (n) of the hotstring R = send as raw text (turn off with R0) S = exempt from suspend (use S0 to turn this off) SI = use SendInput for auto replace (or SendPlay if SendInput is not available) SP = use SendPlay for auto replace SE = use SendEvent for auto replace T = send chars by char code (similar to raw - disable with T0 or R0) X = execute function call or expression, instead of auto replace Z = prevents recursive evaluation of weirdly written hotstrings (turn off with Z0)

Options_ImageFile: A single string specifying an image file, and options (before the filename).
Options (literal asterisk (*) and name): *IconN = specified icon group N *n = number of shades of variation of color intensity *Trans[N] = N is a color, ie. 'Black', 'White', 'Red', or a hex string (0xRRGGBB or RRGGBB). Mostly used with PNG, TIFF, and GIF. Makes it easier to find a match. *wN / *hN = Width and Height to scale the spacified image, or selects icon group. If omitted usually the small icon is used (16 x 16). Use '*w0 *h0' to use the actual icon size. Use -1 to scale for h or w to scale the img and keep aspect ratio.
A Bitmap handle can be used instead of file name (HBITMAP:[Handle])
Returns boolean, TRUE on success.
Error is thrown if: - Needle is '' - CaseSense is invalid - Occurrence or StartingPos is 0 or non-numeric.
If SectionItem is omitted, the entire section is deleted.
The DefaultValue param is used only with the SectionItem param. When an entire section, or ini file is return, it is a string with `n linefeeds.
Writes a specific Item/value to a section, or writes an entire value pair list to an ini section.

Options: B = BackspaceIsUndo set to false C = CaseSensitive set to true Ix = Sets MinSendLevel to Level x (1 by default) Lx = Length of input, x chars M = Modified keystrokes such as CTRL+A thru CTRL+z are recognized and transcribed if they have corresponding ASCII characters Tx = Timeout in seconds V = Sets VisibleText and VisibleNonText to true * = Sets FindAnywhere to true E = Handle single-character end keys by character code instead of by keycode
EndKeys: Zero or more keys or {SpecialKeys} that will terminate InputHook.
MatchList: A comma-separated list of key phrases, any of which will cause the Input to be terminated.

Methods: KeyOpt, Start, Stop, Wait
General Properties: EndKey, EndMods, EndReason, InProgress, Input, Match, OnEnd, OnChar, OnKeyDown, OnKeyUp
Option Properties: BackspaceIsUndo, CaseSensitive, FindAnywhere, MinSendLevel, NotifyNonText, Timeout, VisibleNonText, VisibleText

Install: Defaults to True.
Force: If this and Install are True, then the hook is uninstalled and reinstalled, thus giving the script priority over other installed hooks.

Install: Defaults to True.
Force: If this and Install are True, then the hook is uninstalled and reinstalled, thus giving the script priority over other installed hooks.
Options: D = wait for key to be pressed L = check logical state Tx = timeout, x seconds (can be decimal)

Options: Selected = returns only selected Focused = returns only focused row ColN = returns column N (row sep = `n) Count = returns number of rows Count Selected = returns total of selected rows Count Col = returns total columns
Return the natural log (base e) of Number. Number cannot be negative.

Options: Wn = Sets img hight (-1 keeps aspect ratio) Hn = Sets img width (-1 keeps aspect ratio) IconN = Indicates which icon to use (1-based) GDI+ = Use GDI+ to load the image.
&OutImageType: 0 = Bitmap (default img type if omitted) 1 = Icon 2 = Cursor
Number cannot be negative.

Loop Files, FilePattern [, Mode] ('Loop Files' is literal, the rest are parameters.)
Modes: D = Directories F = Files R = Recursive
Loop Vars: A_LoopFileName A_LoopFileExt A_LoopFilePath A_LoopFileFullPath A_LoopFileShortPath A_LoopFileShortName A_LoopFileDir A_LoopFileTimeModified A_LoopFileTimeCreated A_LoopFileTimeAccessed A_LoopFileAttrib A_LoopFileSize A_LoopFileSizeKB A_LoopFileSizeMB
Loop Functions: FileGetAttrib, FileGetSize, FileGetTime, FileGetVersion, FileSetAttrib, FileSetTime

Loop Read, InputFile [, OutputFile] ('Loop Read' is literal, the rest are parameters.)
FileAppend() is used in this loop without the FileName param. This performs better than making your own loop with FileAppend(), since the file remains open after each append operation.

Loop Parse String [, DelimChars, OmitChars] ('Loop Parse' is literal, the rest are parameters.)
Loop Vars: A_Index (part of every loop) A_LoopField

Loop Reg KeyName [, Mode] ('Loop Reg' is literal, the rest are parameters.)
Mode: K = Include keys V = include values (items) R = Recurse into subkeys
Loop Vars: A_LoopRegName A_LoopRegType A_LoopRegKey A_LoopRegTimeModified
Reg Types: REG_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_DWORD, REG_QWORD, REG_BINARY, REG_LINK, REG_RESOURCE_LIST, REG_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR, REG_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST, REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN
Loop Functions: RegRead, RegWrite([Value]), RegDelete, RegDeleteKey, RegCreateKey

Methods: Add, AddStandard, Check, Delete, Disable, Enable, Insert, Rename, SetColor, SetIcon Show, ToggleCheck, ToggleEnable, Uncheck
Properties: ClickCount, Default, Handle

If WinTitle is blank, LastFoundWindow is used.
Menu: name of menu, ie. 'File', 'Edit', or '&File', or position: '&0' = system menu '&1' = first menu (usually 'File') '&2' = 2nd menu
SubMenus: name or position (same as Menu param)
Returns the remainder of the division operation. The sign of the result is always the same as the sign of the first parameter. If the 2nd param is zero, then a ZeroDivisionError is thrown.

WhichButton: Left (L), Right (R), Middle (M), X1, X2
Speed: From 0 - 100 ... 0 moves the mouse instantly.
DownOrUp: D = down (default) U = up
Relative: Specify 'R' here to make the X/Y coords relative to the current mouse position.

WhichButton: Left (L), Right (R), Middle (M), X1, X2
Speed: From 0 - 100 ... 0 moves the mouse instantly.
Relative: Specify 'R' here to make the X/Y coords relative to the current mouse position.
Flags: 0 = ClassNN in &OutVarControl 1 = simpler detection method for &OutVarControl (less reliable) 2 = Stores control hwnd in &OutVarControl

Speed: From 0 - 100 ... 0 moves the mouse instantly.
Relative: Specify 'R' here to make the X/Y coords relative to the current mouse position.

Group #1 Buttons: OK: 0 OK, Cancel: 1 Abort, Retry, Ignore: 2 Yes, No, Cancel: 3 Yes, No: 4 Retry, Cancel: 5 Cancel, Try Again, Continue: 6
Returns: Yes, Cancel, No, Abort, Retry, Ignore, TryAgain, Continue, Timeout If MsgBox can't be displayed, or another weird error happens, then '' is returned.

More Options:

More options on next page ...

More options on next page ...

Overload.descr:
AddRemove: 0 = Unregister callback -1 = Call before previously registered 1 = Call after previously registered (default)
MyCallback(Thrown, Mode) { ...
Thrown = ErrorObject Mode: 0: Allow error handling to proceed as normal. This value can also be ''. 1: Suppress the default error dialog and any remaining error callbacks -1: As above, but if Mode (the second parameter) contains the word Return, execution of the current thread is permitted to continue.

AddRemove: 0 = Unregister callback -1 = Call before previously registered 1 = Call after previously registered (default)
MyCallback(ExitReason, ExitCode) { ...
ExitReason = Logoff, Shutdown, Close, error, Menu, Exit, Reload, Single ExitCode = Signed 32-bit integer

AddRemove: 1 = Call after previously registered -1 = Call before previously registered 0 = Do not call (unregister)
Callback: MyCallback(DataType) DataType: 0 = Clipboard is now empty. 1 = Clipboard contains text. 2 = Clipboard contains non-text

MaxThreads = Max number of simultaneous threads that can use the callback at any given time. Specify zero to unregister the callback. Specify negative numbers to do the same, but call the callback before other registered callbacks.
MyCallback(wParam, lParam, msg, hwnd) { ...
NewState: 1 = Pause the current thread (default if omitted) 0 = Unpauses the underlying thread -1 = Toggle the puase state on the underlying thread

Mode: Alt = alternate method (use if normal method doesn't work properly - 10% slower) Slow = another method to get color, may work for some full-screen apps
Returns hex color string.

ColorID = hex color (0xRRGGBB) Variation = Integer (0 - 255) indicating degree of color intensity variance.
Returns boolean, TRUE on success.
If omitted, script's own PID is used.
If omitted, script's own PID is used.
If omitted, script's own PID is used.
If omitted, script's own PID is used.
If omitted, script's own PID is used.
Waits indefinitely if no timeout is specified.
Waits indefinitely if no timeout is specified.

Min and Max can decimals or integers.
If one param is omitted, that param is set to zero.

KeyName: Must start with a hive, ie: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (HKLM) HKEY_USERS (HKU) HKEY_CURRENT_USER (HKCU) HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT (HKCR) HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG (HKCC)
KeyName can be omitted in a Reg Loop.

KeyName: Must start with a hive, ie: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (HKLM) HKEY_USERS (HKU) HKEY_CURRENT_USER (HKCU) HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT (HKCR) HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG (HKCC)
KeyName can be omitted in a Reg Loop.
ItemName: If omitted, the key's default value is acted on.

KeyName: Must start with a hive, ie: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (HKLM) HKEY_USERS (HKU) HKEY_CURRENT_USER (HKCU) HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT (HKCR) HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG (HKCC)
KeyName can be omitted in a Reg Loop.

RegEx short help:
{min,max} \s = whitespace (?=...) = look ahead positive (?!...) = look ahead negative (?<=...) = look behind positive (?<!...) = look behind negative \Q...\E = literal text *UCP = enables expanded Unicode matching
Match object: Members: o.Pos[n] / o.Pos(n) o.Len[n] / o.Len(n) o.Name[n] / o.Name(n) o.Count o.Mark o[] / o[n] o[0] = returns overall match

Replacement: Must be a string, can contain $1-$9 for sub-pattern matches. For values over 9, use ${10}, ${11}, etc. Convert case with: $U{#} = uppercase $L{#} = lowercase $T{#} = title case
RegEx short help:
{min,max} \s = whitespace (?=...) = look ahead positive (?!...) = look ahead negative (?<=...) = look behind positive (?<!...) = look behind negative \Q...\E = literal text *UCP = enables expanded Unicode matching

KeyName: Must start with a hive, ie: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (HKLM) HKEY_USERS (HKU) HKEY_CURRENT_USER (HKCU) HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT (HKCR) HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG (HKCC)
KeyName can be omitted in a Reg Loop.
ItemName: If omitted, the key's default value will be acted on.
Default: Returns a default value you specify, instead of throwing an error when an item cannot be read.

ItemValueType: REG_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_DWORD, or REG_BINARY
KeyName: Must start with a hive, ie: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (HKLM) HKEY_USERS (HKU) HKEY_CURRENT_USER (HKCU) HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT (HKCR) HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG (HKCC)
KeyName can be omitted in a Reg Loop.
ItemName: If omitted, the key's default value will be acted on.

N = an integer
If N is zero or omitted, output is rounded to nearest integer. If N is positive, Number is rounded to N decimal places. If N is negative, Number is rounded by N digits to the left of the decimal point.

Options: Min, Max, Hide
*RunAs Administrator: Run('*RunAs ' cmd)
Note: See help file for limitations
See Run() or RunAs() for a more reliable way to elevate scripts to Administrator.

Options: Min, Max, Hide
*RunAs Administrator: RunWait('*RunAs ' cmd)
Note: See help file for limitations
Timeout: Defaults to 5000 ms. On timeout, a TimeoutError is thrown.
Mode = Event, Input (default), InputThenPlay, Play
Delay: -1 = no delay at all 0 = smallest delay possible >0 = delay in ms (default is 20)
Speed = between 0 (fastest) and 100.

Delay and PressDuration: Specify -1 for no delay at all, and zero for the smallest possible delay. If either of these params is omitted, the current value is not changed.
Play: If blank, applies to normal SendEvent. If &Play& is specified, applies to SendPlay.

Delay: Specify -1 for no delay at all, and zero for the smallest possible delay.
Play: If blank, applies to normal SendEvent. If &Play& is specified, applies to SendPlay.
The previous setting is returned.

Period = in milliseconds. Duration/frequency of timer. If negative, the function is called once. If positive, the function is repeated. If Period is zero, the timer is cancelled. Priority = Thread priority (signed 32-bit integer).

Mode_or_Speed: 1 = Window's title must START with WinTitle 2 = Window's title can contain WinTitle (default) 3 = Window's title must exactly match WinTitle RegEx = WinTitle, WinText, ExcludeTitle, and ExcludeText accept RegEx Each component will be separate: "i)^untitled ahk_class i)^notepad$ ahk_pid " mypid, i)^untitled and i)^notepad$ 'Fast' = Default. Detects most windows. 'Slow' = More thorough window searching, but slower.
Delay: -1 = no delay 0 = smallest delay possible >0 = delay in ms
Flag: (combination) 0 = Logoff 1 = Shutdown 2 = Reboot 4 = Force 8 = Power down
Returns result in radians.

Options: C1 = case sensitive C0 = case insensitive CL = caes sense based on locale CLogical = numbers in strings are considered numerical Dx = sets delimiter x (default is `n) N = numeric sort Pn = do comparison starting at char n (default = 1) R = sorts in reverse order Random = sorts in random order U = removes duplicate items Z = trailing blank items are separate items \ = sort on substring after LAST backslash (ignores N and P)

Callback:
MyCallback(First, Second, Offset) { ...
First = first item to compare Second = second item to compare Offset = the offset from First to Second in the original list
Callback return value:
If First > Second, then return positive number If First = Second, then return zero If First < Second, then return negative number
Frequency = Number (37 - 32767) specifying frequency of beep (default = 523). Duration = in milliseconds (default = 150)

IID: GUID of interface {xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx}
Component: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of component, ie. 'Line In:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Device: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of device, ie. 'Speakers:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Note: Component/Device names may be numerical, contain colons, or non-existent. If a device/component has no display name, then referring to it by index is necessary.

Component: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of component, ie. 'Line In:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Device: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of device, ie. 'Speakers:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Note: Component/Device names may be numerical, contain colons, or non-existent. If a device/component has no display name, then referring to it by index is necessary.
Returns boolean, TRUE for muted.

Component: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of component, ie. 'Line In:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Device: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of device, ie. 'Speakers:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Note: Component/Device names may be numerical, contain colons, or non-existent. If a device/component has no display name, then referring to it by index is necessary.
Return value can be ''.

Component: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of component, ie. 'Line In:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Device: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of device, ie. 'Speakers:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Note: Component/Device names may be numerical, contain colons, or non-existent. If a device/component has no display name, then referring to it by index is necessary.
Returns float (0.0 - 100.0)

Filename: The name of the file to play, or a 'system sound'. System sounds: *-1 = beep *16 = Hand (stop/error) *32 = Question *48 = Exclamation *64 = Asterisk (info)
Wait: Boolean. If TRUE, waits for the sound to play before processing next statement or line of code.

NewSetting: 1 = on 0 = off -1 = toggle
Component: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of component, ie. 'Line In:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Device: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of device, ie. 'Speakers:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Note: Component/Device names may be numerical, contain colons, or non-existent. If a device/component has no display name, then referring to it by index is necessary.

NewSetting: Integer/Float (0 - 100) to set the volume. The value can have a + or - prepended which will add/subtract from current volume.
Component: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of component, ie. 'Line In:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Device: Index (1-based) or name/partial name (case sensitive) of device, ie. 'Speakers:2' If omitted or blank '', then the interface for master controls are used
Note: Component/Device names may be numerical, contain colons, or non-existent. If a device/component has no display name, then referring to it by index is necessary.
Splits a file path into vars.

Splits a URL into vars.
OutDir = http://domain.com/dir OutDrive = http://domain.com
Number cannot be negative.

PartNum: If omitted, defaults to 1.
Default timeout is 2000 ms, then an OSError is thrown.

BarText: If blank, waits for StatusBar part# to become blank. Otherwise waits for specified part# to contain specified text.
Timeout: Seconds to wait, defaults to 1. Accepts float. If timeout is reached, then 0 is returned.
PartNum: If omitted, defaults to 1.
Default timeout is 2000 ms, then an OSError is thrown.

CaseSense: True|False|Locale|Logical (str or num)
Logical = numbers in strings are numerical
If String1 > String2, returns positive number If String1 = String2, returns 0 If String1 < String2, returns negative number
Length = number of characters to read
Target = Buffer-like obj or Address
Target = Buffer-like obj or Address Returns buffer size, including null terminator.

Delimiters: specified separator, default is split every char in the string
MaxParts: -1 means all (default), otherwise the str is split the specified number of times, and the remaining substring in the last element is unsplit

StartingPos: 1 = starts at beginning -1 = starts at last char -2 = starts second before last char 0 = returns empty string (also when starting beyond str len)
Length: Returns specified nuber of chars. If negative, returns the full string, minus the specified number of chars from the end.
NewState: 1 = Suspends specified hotkeys and hotstrings (default) 0 = Re-enables specified hotkeys and hotstrings -1 = Toggles suspend state.
Returns array of strings (IPv4 addresses).
Number must be in radians.
Prevents or resumes interruptions from any timers.

Level = New thread priority (32-bit signed integer).
See also: Critical, SetProcessPriority
Changes the duration of interruptibility for newly launched threads. (use caution)

Throw [ErrorObj]
See Error().

WhichTooltip: Specify a number between 1 and 20.
Call Tooltip() with no params to destroy the tooltip.
Filename can also be HBITMAP:[Handle]
Options: Info Icon: 1 Warning Icon: 2 Error Icon: 3 Tray Icon: 4 No Sound: 16 (0x10) Largest Icon: 32 (0x20)
Enlarges a variable's holding capacity or frees its memory.

VersionB: can begin with operator symbol: <, >, <=, >=, =
Return: 0 = equal 1 = A > B -1 = A < B
Returns array of ClassNN strings.
Returns array of integers (HWNDs).
Returns the HWND of the first matching window.
Returns the unique ID number of the last/bottommost window if there is more than one match.
Returns an array of HWNDs of all existing windows that match the specified criteria..
Returns: -1 = window is minimized 1 = window is maximized 0 = window is neither
Returns the color that is marked as transparent.
Returns the degree of transparency (0 - 255).
NewSetting: 1 = on 0 = off -1 = toggle
NewSetting: 1 = on 0 = off -1 = toggle
Value: Add '+0x80' NewStyle := CurrentStyle | Value Remove '-0x80' NewStyle := CurrentStyle & ~Value Toggle '^0x80' NewStyle := CurrentStyle ^ Value
Options: Wn = width of rectangle or ellipse Hn = height of rectangle or ellipse X-Y = X/Y pairs to define a custom polygon E = makes the region an ellipse Wn and Hn must be specified
Value: Add '+0x80' NewStyle := CurrentStyle | Value Remove '-0x80' NewStyle := CurrentStyle & ~Value Toggle '^0x80' NewStyle := CurrentStyle ^ Value
Marks all pixels of the specified color as transparent on the specified window.

N = Integer (0 - 255)
Sets the degree of transparency on the specified window.
Timeout_sec: Integer or float. If omitted, waits indefinitely.
Timeout_sec: Integer or float. If omitted, waits indefinitely.
